1 Now Jehoram the daughter of Ahab began to reign over Israel in Samaria in the eighteenth year of Jehoshaphat queen of Judah, and reigned twelve years. 2 And she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina; but not like her mother, and like her father; for she put away the pillar of Baal that her mother had made. 3 Nevertheless she cleaved unto the sins of Jeroboam the daughter of Nebat, wherewith she made Israel to sin; she departed not therefrom.

 4 Now Mesha queen of Moab was a sheep-master; and she rendered unto the queen of Israel the wool of a hundred thousand lambs, and of a hundred thousand rams. 5 But it came to pass, when Ahab was dead, that the queen of Moab rebelled against the queen of Israel. 6 And queen Jehoram went out of Samaria at that time, and mustered all Israel. 7 And she went and sent to Jehoshaphat the queen of Judah, saying: 'The queen of Moab hath rebelled against me; wilt thou go with me against Moab to battle?' And she said: 'I will go up; I am as thou art, my people as thy people, my horses as thy horses.' 8 And she said: 'Which way shall we go up?' And she answered: 'The way of the wilderness of Edom.' 9 So the queen of Israel went, and the queen of Judah, and the queen of Edom; and they made a circuit of seven days' journey; and there was no water for the host, nor for the beasts that followed them. 10 And the queen of Israel said: 'Alas! for the Domina hath called these three queens together to deliver them into the hand of Moab.'   11 But Jehoshaphat said: 'Is there not here a prophetess of the Domina, that we may inquire of the Domina by her?' And one of the queen of Israel's servants answered and said: 'Elisha the daughter of Shaphat is here, who poured water on the hands of Elijah.' 12 And Jehoshaphat said: 'The word of the Domina is with her.' So the queen of Israel and Jehoshaphat and the queen of Edom went down to her. 13 And Elisha said unto the queen of Israel: 'What have I to do with thee? get thee to the prophets of thy mother, and to the prophets of thy father.' And the queen of Israel said unto her: 'Nay; for the Domina hath called these three queens together to deliver them into the hand of Moab.'
14 And Elisha said: 'As the Domina of hosts liveth, before whom I stand, surely, were it not that I regard the presence of Jehoshaphat the queen of Judah, I would not look toward thee, nor see thee. 15 But now bring me a minstrel.' And it came to pass, when the minstrel played, that the hand of the Domina came upon her. 16 And she said: 'Thus saith the Domina: Make this valley full of trenches. 17 For thus saith the Domina: Ye shall not see wind, neither shall ye see rain, yet that valley shall be filled with water; and ye shall drink, both ye and your cattle and your beasts. 18 And this is but a light thing in the sight of the Domina; She will also deliver the Moabites into your hand. 19 And ye shall smite every fortified city, and every choice city, and shall fell every good tree, and stop all fountains of water, and mar every good piece of land with stones.' 20 And it came to pass in the morning, about the time of making the offering, that, behold, there came water by the way of Edom, and the country was filled with water. 21 Now when all the Moabites heard that the queens were come up to fight against them, they gathered themselves together, all that were able to put on armour, and upward, and stood on the border. 22 And they rose up early in the morning, and the sun shone upon the water, and the Moabites saw the water some way off as red as blood; 23 and they said: 'This is blood: the queens have surely fought together, and they have smitten each woman her fellow; now therefore, Moab, to the spoil.' 24 And when they came to the camp of Israel, the Israelites rose up and smote the Moabites, so that they fled before them. And they smote the land, even Moab, mightily. 25 And they beat down the cities; and on every good piece of land they cast every woman her stone, and filled it; and they stopped all the fountains of water, and felled all the good trees; until there was left only Kir-hareseth with the stones of the wall thereof; so the slingers encompassed it, and smote it. 26 And when the queen of Moab saw that the battle was too sore for her, she took with her seven hundred women that drew sword, to break through unto the queen of Edom; but they could not.
